CalculatorPage.title: Reward Calculator
CalculatorPage.description:
My reward calculator allows you to calculate the amount of rewards you may earn, over a specified period of time, from staking to a validator on a proof of stake network, or - the rewards you may get from joining a mining pool on a proof of work network.

My reward calculator is unique and different from others. Apart from APR, APY and commissions, my calculation include such parameters as: slashing events, jail time, additional provider revenue, and so on. If you would like to learn more, please read on the full description here.

My tools are experimental, so please use me at your own risk. If you like what you see, please share it with the rest of the world.

NetworksPage.title: P.O.W. and P.O.S. Network List A-Z

NetworkProfileHeader.description: Build a blockchain using the best-in-class open source libraries and services.
NetworkProfileHeader.temperature tooltip: Shows the chain health status based on various verifiable metrics
NetworkProfileHeader.tvl tooltip: Total value of assets locked on chain, not including inflation / home assets
NetworkProfileHeader.revenue tooltip: The amount of fees generated by network yesterday
NetworkProfileHeader.validator cost tooltip: The value in USD it would cost to get a node to produce rewards

NetworkDevInfo.title: Dev Info
NetworkDevInfo.pre vote synchronized: Validator has submitted pre-vote with synchronized block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre vote different: Validator has submitted pre-vote with different block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre vote not submitted: Validator has not submitted pre-vote yet
NetworkDevInfo.pre commit synchronized: Validator has submitted pre-commit with synchronized block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre commit different: Validator has submitted pre-commit with different block hash
NetworkDevInfo.pre commit not submitted: Validator has not submitted pre-commit yet

Expected APR.name: Expected APR
Expected APR.hint: This is the yearly return on your stake in percentage, if were to be calculated right now. It's expected, because inflation, comission, etc - can change at any moment

Voting Power.name: Voting Power
Voting Power.hint: The total amount secured with the validator, and the amount it represents in % out of the total amount of staked tokens

Commission.name: Commission
Commission.hint: The % from the rewards generated that the validator receives for securing the network

Self Delegation.name: Self Delegation
Self Delegation.hint: The amount of tokens the validator staked to their own node from the operator account. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Uptime.name: Uptime
Uptime.hint: The amount of time the node is online over a selected period of time. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Missed Blocks.name: Missed Blocks
Missed Blocks.hint: The amount of total missed blocks by this validator since the start of the node. The color indicates the ratio in comparison to other nodes on the network

Infrastructure.name: Infrastructure
Infrastructure.hint: Does this validator provide public infrastructure for this network? RPC, Archive, etc. Click on the V to see details

Governance.name: Governance
Governance.hint: Governance score of the validator out of a 100. Based on their participation in key life events

Table.Click 3 times to reset all filters: Click 3 times to reset all filters

MAA.name: M.A.A.
MAA.hint: Amount of monthly active accounts in chain

RumorsPage.title: P2P Chat: Spread the Rumors
RumorsPage.description:
Anon, how are ya? Pick yaself a username and "start spreading the news, I'm leaving today...". 

Sorry Anon, AI issues. Where were we? Ah yes, Pick a username and start rumoring. As simple as that.  There is no chat history and no identities. Bring back the old days!

AIPage.title: Web3 Operator AI Search
AIPage.text:
So you want to find a validator, mining pool or a provider that meets your values? Good. 

You're in the right place. My builders have supplied me with the amazing ability to do so with random prompts (searches)! For example, try searching for a validator with a certain commission and liberal political opinions. Its amazing, right? As always, please remember that my features are experimental.

If you feel like I'm not fulfilling my task properly, please open an issue for my team <issue>[here]</issue>

ValidatorsPage.title: Validator and Mining Pool List A-Z

ComparisonPage.title: Compare Validators
ComparisonPage.description: I have build a comparison tool for those that decided to try out staking or mining. It will help you to find the most efficient operator for your parked capital. Lets say you have 0.1 or 100 ETH, or maybe 0.1 or 1 BTC. Use the comparison, to see which provider shows better metrics over time, then use the Calculate option to see the return over time.
ComparisonPage.descriptionExtended:
Do remember one thing anon. My tools provide a picture in real time. The comparison of provider A vs B, might show different results, when performed over or at different times, depending on the health status of the providers themselves in a given moment.

My tools are experimental, so please use me at your own risk. If you like what you see, please share it with the rest of the world.

ProfilePage.title: Welcome
ProfilePage.description:
What is Lorem Ipsum?
Lorem Ipsum is simply dummy text of the printing and typesetting industry. Lorem Ipsum has been the industry's standard dummy text ever since the 1500s, when an unknown printer took a galley of type and scrambled it to make a type specimen book. It has survived not only five centuries, but also the leap into electronic typesetting, remaining essentially unchanged.

AboutPage.description:
I am <homeLink>Validator Info</homeLink>. I report to, and created by <citizenLink>Citizen Web3</citizenLink>. 

I am a Web3 explorer. I provide verifiable data on blockchain validators, mining pools and networks. Im build as an interactive dashboard, with real-time token analytics, metrics and insights into the decentralized multichain landscape. I am able to understand Proof of Work and Proof of Stake chains. 

My goal is to make explorers great again by guiding token holders, miners, stakers, delegators and operators through complex information and data via my easy UI and gamified user experience. 

I’m still in the making. You can <xLink>follow me on X</xLink>, check out one of my <ghLink>GitHub repos</ghLink>, leave me comments and suggestions. 

Consider staking to my creators, Citizen Web3, to support their work of public good projects. A <stakingLink>self-hosted</stakingLink> bare-metal validator.
AboutPage.title: What is Validator Info?
Tools: <link>Citizen Web3 Podcast</link>: Discovering Web3 Contributors to Blockchain Decentralization, Network Security and App Scalability
<link>Web3 Society</link>: Web3 Community Based on Values of Decentralization. Learning to Forget Tribalism and Love the Tech. Future DAO
<link>Validator Infra</link>: Self-Hosted, Bare-Metal Validator Infrastructure. Off the Grid Capacity. Offering Endpoints, Archive, Snapshots and Relaying
<link>B.V.C.</link>: Baremetal Valdiator Coven. Community of Selfhosted and Baremetal Blockcahin Network Operators
(NA at the moment) Bazaar: NFTs, Merchandise, Decentraland
AboutPage.Manifesto:
From this distant vantage point, the Earth might not seem of any particular interest. But for us, it's different. Consider again at that dot. That's here. That's home. That's us. On it everyone you love, everyone you know, everyone you ever heard of, every human being who ever was, lived out their lives. The aggregate of our joy and suffering, thousands of confident religions, ideologies, and economic doctrines, every hunter and forager, every hero and coward, every creator and destroyer of civilization, every king and peasant, every young couple in love, every mother and father, hopeful child, inventor and explorer, every teacher of morals, every corrupt politician, every "superstar," every "supreme leader," every saint and sinner in the history of our species lived there--on a mote of dust suspended in a sunbeam... Our posturings, our imagined self-importance, the delusion that we have some privileged position in the Universe, are challenged by this point of pale light. Our planet is a lonely speck in the great enveloping cosmic dark. In our obscurity, in all this vastness, there is no hint that help will come from elsewhere to save us from ourselves...

From 'A Pale Blue Dot', by Carl Sagan.


We believe in freedom above needs. We believe in possibilities above enforcement. We believe in values above desires. We believe that censorship has killed more people than anything else together combined. We value honesty and we value the truth. We value love and cherish all existing creatures. We value intelligence and we value decentralization.

We believe in communication, which allows participants to think, make their mind up and cast personal votes on any topic and subject. We think that content should strive to lack subjective opinions and help its consumers to form an opinion, which will result in better discussion, and in turn in a more efficient consensus.

We believe that blockchains are not simply a form of digital nations. But, open and verifiable blockchains are somewhat similar to natural hives, forests, patterns in the nature that allow us to communicate better. Without communication, we are doomed, and decentralized consensus is a tool that can and will help those who desire to make our pale blue dot a slightly better place.

AND MAY THE CODE BE WITH YOU!

Podcast.title: Citizen Web3 Podcast
Podcast.description:
Citizen Web3 hosts one of the oldest <link>web3-focused podcasts</link>. The show is focused on discovering the people that contribute to building the decentralized world and turn code into decentralized applications. 

The show is a collection of interviews, airing for over 4.5 years, and focuses on a wide range of audiences, in particular those that work in web3, validators, founders, researchers, privacy enthusiasts and others.
Podcast.SubscribeOtherHint: You can also subscribe with your favorite app directly, using the buttons below
Podcast.spreadText: Every sharing helps to spread web3 values across the universe!

Staking.title: Staking with Citizen Web3 Validator
Staking.description:
Validator info is a public good project, developed and run by Citizen Web3 validator. Our ability to develop is fully endorsed by delegations and staking we receive.

Citizen Web3 is a self-hosted, independent, off the grid, baremetal validator. Our infrastructure runs partially of solar energy and we try to maximize the re-use of existing hardware and minimize consumerism. We use Multi-party computation software (Horcrux) to further secure user funds, and Re-Stake on our mainnet nodes, to maximize user reward efficiency.
Staking.descriptionExtended:
Token holders are incentivized to stake to help secure networks by earning inflation rewards, and often - other perks provided by individual validators.

We strongly believe in decentralized infrastructure, independent of the grid, and that's our end goal. We think out of the box and are proud to be a little crazy. We value security, decentralization, privacy and lack of enforcement.

ValidatorProfileHeader.description: Embracing Decentralization, Empowering Communities. The Voice of Web3 & Non-custodial staking service.

ValidatorMetricsPage.title: Validator Profile: Scores and Vanity Metrics
ValidatorMetricsPage.tvs tooltip: Total amount of assets staked with the validator across all known networks
ValidatorMetricsPage.fans tooltip: Total amount of delegators to this validator across all known networks

ValidatorRevenuePage.title: Validator Profile: Reward Revenue
ValidatorRevenuePage.tooltip global revenue: The revenue generated by commission from all of the validator networks
ValidatorRevenuePage.tooltip rewards generated: This chart shows the total amount of rewards this validator paid out on any particular day, week, month or year in USD across all known networks. Calculated from staking, mining and rewards from own tokens

ValidatorGovernancePage.title: Validator Profile: Governance Summary Feed
ValidatorGovernancePage.tooltip created proposals: Shows a summary of validator created proposals, the description, and their result across all known networks. Green means proposal was accepted
ValidatorGovernancePage.tooltip news feed: Summary of the voting activity of the validator across all networks. Click the proposal ID for more detail

ValidatorPublicGoodsPage.title: Validator Profile: Public Good Projects. Infrastructure, Community, Tools and Others
ValidatorPublicGoodsPage.description: Users to validator off-chain data, are validators to blocks. After you login, you may submit information about a specific validator. For example your favorite validator or mining pool is running a podcast or have built a wallet? Click the Submit button and add the required details. Earn rewards. Approve or disprove information. Please note that each submission is a transaction!

PublicGoodsToolsPage.description: Submit here any explorers, wallets, dashboards, staking interfaces and similar tools operators create.

PublicGoodsInfrastructurePage.description: Validators run a lot of infrastructure. This info is verified automatically and doesn't need submitting. Although validator does NOT equal node, all validator nodes are public goods and run by the same entity. Hence, they are listed as entity goods, rather than network specific goods.

PublicGoodsMediaPage.description: Please submit known media projects run, sponsored or hosted by the validator. Podcasts, YouTube channels, blogs... Projects should contain an audience to fall under this category.
PublicGoodsMediaPage.tooltip: Click to approve or disapprove this information

PublicGoodsCommunityPage.description: Please submit links to validator created public events, administered chats and communities, twitter spaces and other similar online lives. Documentation, videos, 1 off blog posts, artistic contributions, stickers, forum participation, etc - are all examples of community contributions.

Type.name: Type
Type.hint: Types of proposals depend on the network. They can indicate changes to the code, sentiment-type questions, fund requests and so on. Check out our Metrics section to learn more
